intro: Spermacoce pumilio, commonly known as the small cowberry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a small herbaceous shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature, containing several seeds. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. Spermacoce pumilio is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
